text:
I have two OS on this system one primary and one backup, both are win XP pro 
build 2600 sp1. Primary OS is on partion c:,Backup OS is on partion d:, c: and 
d: NTFS format disc 1, Partion e: is a ghost image of c: and d: and is a DOS 
FAT32X partion, parition f: empty DOS FAT32X, e: and f: are on disc 2. 
Apache2.0.48 is installed on both c: and d: along with active state perl5.8.2, 
imagemagick5.5.8, python2.3.2 Apache will suddenly stop randomly and will not 
start again even if reinstalled, gives an error code 1 from a services start, 
windows says to contact the vernder of this error. The HDD needs to be 
formated and the system reloaded from a ghost image for Apache to start again, 
uninstalling Apache and reinstalling it will have no positive effect.
creator: Don.Dion@cox.net
wrowe@apache.org
text:
In order to begin processing this error, we need to know what the problem
  was (you don't say).  Would suggest that you review the server's error log
  file (in path-to-apache/logs/error.log), as well as the Windows Application
  Error Log (Start -> Settings -> Admin Tools -> Event Viewer, then switch to
  the Application log view.)

  When the popup occurs ('send report to ms?'), you can usually get a more 
  detailed log of the crash, including some backtrace information.  Please
  attach that to the bugreport and reopen with the relevant suggested details.

creator: erik@codefaktor.de
text:
No further response, closing. Feel free to reopen if you can provide the additional information 
requested.
